_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a)  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

CYRO is dedicated to protecting safety, health and the environment.  Our commitment to protect our employees and the communities that are home to our operations is an integral part of CYRO's way of doing business.  CYRO has established safety, health, emergency response and environmental policies and standards designed to meet or exceed all regulatory requirements.  CYRO subscribes to the codes established for Responsible Care (R).

(b)  THE WALLINGFORD PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Our facility manufactures acrylics that are used to make medical devices and other plastic products.  The regulated substance used above threshold quanity is acrylonitrile.

(c)  THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RESEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

CYRO's general accidental release prevention program includes:

- EPA 40 CFR 68 - Risk Management Plans
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 - Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 - Hazardous Waste Operations & Emergency Response
- Other EPA, OSHA, DOT and State regulations
- Generally recognized & accepted engineering codes and standards, and
- CYRO and the Site Safety, Health, Environmental and Engineering standards.

The following engineering and administrative controls help prevent a release of acrylonitrile and formaldehyde:
- Operating procedures and attendance during transfer operations by trained personnel
- Locked transfer connections with verification of materials prior to unloading
- High level, temperature and pressure controls with alarms and/or automatic shutoffs
- Fire prevention programs include Nitrogen inerting of certain process vessels, grounding systems, electrical wiring and equipment rated for hazardous equipment where necessary 
- Distributed computer control systems with uninterruptible power backup and independent safety and environmental alarms and/or interlocks
- Multiple level indicators

and spill containment for storage tanks and production vessels
- An industrial waste water treatment plant
- 24 hour security guards and plant fire department presence
- Back up systems for process pneumatics, lighting, electrical power to certain process equipment, emergency cooling, process water, back-up power for plant communications 
- Fire extinguishing systems include water sprinklers, AFFF foam monitors a halon system, fire doors and fire valves on certain vessels
- Administrative controls include management of change procedures, mechanical integrity procedures, operating procedures, training programs for employees and contractors, contractor review procedures, pre-startup safety review procedures, process hazards analysis procedures, safety work permit procedures, hot work permit procedures and lockout procedures

(d)  5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no incidents at the Wallingford Plant which meet the criteria for reporting in the previous five-years.
                                  
(e) EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Wallingford Plant has an extensive emergency response program.  This program includes actions to be taken by operating department, maintenance, utilities, office, technical, visitors, contractors, and plant emergency response employees.  The onsite Fire Department drills regularly on various scenarios with the Town of Wallingford's Fire Department and is active in the Wallingford Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  Drills with the Wallingford Fire Department are conducted several times a year and hands-on-training (i.e. structural fire fighting) is periodically provided at the Town Fire Service Training area.  In addition, CYRO Emergency Response teams help provide training in hazardous materials to the Municipal Fire Department personnel.

(f)  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

CYRO Industries is continuously striving to upgrade its processes, control technology, employee training, inspection, repair and maintenance of
process equipment in order to improve safety.  We will continue to improve in the future.
